intro: Boerhavia repleta, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb that thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant features fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, pink to purple flowers bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Boerhavia repleta is known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh landscapes.
